thread.title: Remember when Playboy said they wouldn't feature nudes? Yeah, they've changed their minds.
thread.title_full: Remember when Playboy said they wouldn't feature nudes? Yeah, they've changed their minds. - Houston Chronicle

author: chron.com
title: Remember when Playboy said they wouldn't feature nudes? Yeah, they've changed their minds.
text:
Photo: Playboy Image 1 of / 111 111 Playboy is going back to featuring nudes in their magazines. This is a photo of the magazine's March/April cover. Continue clicking to see past Playboy covers featuring top actresses through the years.
Playboy is going back to featuring nudes in their magazines. This is a photo of the magazine's March/April cover. Continue clicking to see past Playboy covers featuring top actresses through the years.
Photo: Playboy Image 2 of 111 A blonde Lindsey Lohan on the Holiday Anniversary issue. January/February 2012 A blonde Lindsey Lohan on the Holiday Anniversary issue. January/February 2012 Image 3 of 111 Tara Reid and her assets graced the cover of the Massive Double issue. January/February 2010 Tara Reid and her assets graced the cover of the Massive Double issue. January/February 2010 Image 4 of 111 Madonna shortly after her successful release of "Like a Virgin." September 1985. Madonna shortly after her successful release of "Like a Virgin." September 1985. Image 5 of 111 Anna Faris embracing the role in her movie "House Bunny." September 2008. Anna Faris embracing the role in her movie "House Bunny." September 2008. Image 6 of 111 Donald Trump and Brandi Brandt bring black tie to the cover. March 1990. Donald Trump and Brandi Brandt bring black tie to the cover. March 1990. Image 7 of 111 Jenny McCarthy returns to the cover in a leopard skin version of the Playboy bunny suit. January 2005 Jenny McCarthy returns to the cover in a leopard skin version of the Playboy bunny suit. January 2005 Image 8 of 111 "Sons of Anarchy" star Winter Ave Zoli graced the cover for a motorcycle themed issue. March 2011. "Sons of Anarchy" star Winter Ave Zoli graced the cover for a motorcycle themed issue. March 2011. Image 9 of 111 Pam Anderson has graced the cover of Playboy more times than anyone else. Her work with the magazine spans 22 years (1989-2011). November 1994. Pam Anderson has graced the cover of Playboy more times than anyone else. Her work with the magazine spans 22 years (1989-2011). November 1994. Image 10 of 111 One of Carmen Electra's several appearances in Playboy – her first was in 1996, over a decade earlier. January 2009. One of Carmen Electra's several appearances in Playboy – her first was in 1996, over a decade earlier. January 2009. Image 11 of 111 Jessica Alba on the cover of the Sex and Music issue. March 2006. Jessica Alba on the cover of the Sex and Music issue. March 2006. Image 12 of 111 Right after she split from the Spice Girls, Gerri Halliwell took her platform boots and UK pride to the cover of Playboy. May 1998 Right after she split from the Spice Girls, Gerri Halliwell took her platform boots and UK pride to the cover of Playboy. May 1998 Image 13 of 111 Portrayed as one of the "bad girls" of television, Shannen Doherty poses for the Gala Christmas issue. (We're guessing she was on the naughty list). December 2003. Portrayed as one of the "bad girls" of television, Shannen Doherty poses for the Gala Christmas issue. (We're guessing she was on the naughty list). December 2003. Image 14 of 111 Mariah Carey on the cover of the Sex and Music issue. March 2007. Mariah Carey on the cover of the Sex and Music issue. March 2007. Image 15 of 111 Comedian Jerry Seinfeld is one of the few men to share the cover of Playboy. October 1993. Comedian Jerry Seinfeld is one of the few men to share the cover of Playboy. October 1993. Image 16 of 111 Photographer Herb Ritts took this stunning cover shot of Cindy Crawford, along with the spread inside. July 1988. Photographer Herb Ritts took this stunning cover shot of Cindy Crawford, along with the spread inside. July 1988. Image 17 of 111 Barbra Streisand appeared on the cover of Playboy in 1977. Barbra Streisand appeared on the cover of Playboy in 1977. Image 18 of 111 La Toya Jackson in studded leather after a falling out with her famous family. March 1989 La Toya Jackson in studded leather after a falling out with her famous family. March 1989 Image 19 of 111 The first cover of Playboy featured Marilyn Monroe, though the shots were from a calendar shoot and she never actually posed for Playboy. It was undated as Hugh Hefner was unsure if there would be a second. December 1953. less The first cover of Playboy featured Marilyn Monroe, though the shots were from a calendar shoot and she never actually posed for Playboy. It was undated as Hugh Hefner was unsure if there would be a second. ... more Image 20 of 111 Jayne Mansfield and Mr. Playboy share a locket on the cover of the February 1957 issue. Jayne Mansfield and Mr. Playboy share a locket on the cover of the February 1957 issue. Image 21 of 111 Country icon Dolly Parton. October 1978 Country icon Dolly Parton. October 1978 Image 22 of 111 The Girls of James Bond issue. July 1979 The Girls of James Bond issue. July 1979 Image 23 of 111 Steve Martin poses for the Wild and Crazy Anniversary issue. January 1980. Steve Martin poses for the Wild and Crazy Anniversary issue. January 1980. Image 24 of 111 Actress Mariel Hemingway getting physical on the cover of the April 1982 issue Actress Mariel Hemingway getting physical on the cover of the April 1982 issue Image 25 of 111 Joan Collins, star of "Dynasty" strikes a pose. December 1983. Joan Collins, star of "Dynasty" strikes a pose. December 1983. Image 26 of 111 Suzanne Somers poses on the cover of the Gala Christmas issue. December 1984. Suzanne Somers poses on the cover of the Gala Christmas issue. December 1984. Image 27 of 111 Anna Nicole Smith's first cover for Playboy. March 1992. Anna Nicole Smith's first cover for Playboy. March 1992. Image 28 of 111 One of many Baywatch babes to grace the cover, Erika Eleniak poses for the Gala Christmas issue. December 1993. One of many Baywatch babes to grace the cover, Erika Eleniak poses for the Gala Christmas issue. December 1993. Image 29 of 111 Farrah Fawcett on the Gala Christmas issue, at 48 years old ... just, wow. December 1995. Farrah Fawcett on the Gala Christmas issue, at 48 years old ... just, wow. December 1995. Image 30 of 111 Playboy model turned actress, Donna D'Errico, returned to the cover a year after her departure from the magazine to celebrate her new role on TV's "Baywatch." November 1996 Playboy model turned actress, Donna D'Errico, returned to the cover a year after her departure from the magazine to celebrate her new role on TV's "Baywatch." November 1996 Image 31 of 111 Claudia Schiffer graces the cover of the Music and Supermodels issue. May 1997. Claudia Schiffer graces the cover of the Music and Supermodels issue. May 1997. Image 32 of 111 WWE wrestler Sable stepped out of the ring and onto the cover of the April 1999 issue. WWE wrestler Sable stepped out of the ring and onto the cover of the April 1999 issue. Image 33 of 111 Christine Nielsen poses in for the Women of Enron spread along with several of her former female co-workers almost a year after the October 2001 scandal. August 2002. Christine Nielsen poses in for the Women of Enron spread along with several of her former female co-workers almost a year after the October 2001 scandal. August 2002. Image 34 of 111 Actresses, celebrities and models have graced the covers of Playboy magazine since it launched in 1953. See some of the more popular models and where they are now.
Actresses, celebrities and models have graced the covers of Playboy magazine since it launched in 1953. See some of the more popular models and where they are now. Photo: Rick Maiman, Bloomberg Image 35 of 111 | Marilyn Monroe Actress Marilyn Monroe was the first Playmate of the Month in Playboy's first issue in December 1953. Actress Marilyn Monroe was the first Playmate of the Month in Playboy's first issue in December 1953. Image 36 of 111 | Marilyn Monroe Monroe later died in 1962 at the age of 36. Following her death, she was ranked as the sixth greatest female star of all time by the American Film Institute.
Monroe later died in 1962 at the age of 36. Following her death, she was ranked as the sixth greatest female star of all time by the American Film Institute. Photo: Mel Bouzad, Getty Images Image 37 of 111 | Pamela Anderson Pamela Anderson first graced the cover of Playboy in 1989. Since then, Anderson has appeared on more covers than anyone else.
Pamela Anderson first graced the cover of Playboy in 1989. Since then, Anderson has appeared on more covers than anyone else. Image 38 of 111 | Pamela Anderson Pamela Anderson has been a vegetarian for years, and is an outspoken animal rights activist and PETA spokesperson. She appeared on Dancing with the Stars in 2010 and 2012.
Pamela Anderson has been a vegetarian for years, and is an outspoken animal rights activist and PETA spokesperson. She appeared on Dancing with the Stars in 2010 and 2012. Photo: Michael Buckner, Getty Images Image 39 of 111 | Dolly Parton Singer and songwriter Dolly Parton made her Playboy debut in October 1978. Singer and songwriter Dolly Parton made her Playboy debut in October 1978. Image 40 of 111 | Dolly Parton Parton is set to release her 42nd studio album in 2014.
Parton is set to release her 42nd studio album in 2014. Photo: Dollywood Image 41 of 111 | Suzanne Somers Suzanne Somers' 1984 cover was her second appearance on Playboy. She apparently did a test shoot in 1970 which were published a decade later when she was starring in "Three's Company".
Suzanne Somers' 1984 cover was her second appearance on Playboy. She apparently did a test shoot in 1970 which were published a decade later when she was starring in "Three's Company". Image 42 of 111 | Suzanne Somers Following her Playboy cover, Somers starred in "Step by Step", wrote a series of books, and sells beauty and health products on her business site.
Following her Playboy cover, Somers starred in "Step by Step", wrote a series of books, and sells beauty and health products on her business site. Photo: AP2003 Image 43 of 111 | Lindsay Lohan Lindsay Lohan appeared on the cover of Playboy in the January/February 2012 edition. Lindsay Lohan appeared on the cover of Playboy in the January/February 2012 edition. Image 44 of 111 | Lindsay Lohan Following her Playboy shoot, Lohan starred in two critically-panned films: "Liz & Dick" and "Canyons". She later pleaded no contest to reckless driving and was sentenced to community service and rehab.
Following her Playboy shoot, Lohan starred in two critically-panned films: "Liz & Dick" and "Canyons". She later pleaded no contest to reckless driving and was sentenced to community service and rehab. Image 45 of 111 | Barbra Streisand Barbra Streisand appeared on the cover of Playboy in 1977.
Barbra Streisand appeared on the cover of Playboy in 1977. Image 46 of 111 | Barbra Streisand Streisand recently gave two concerts in June 2013 and starred in "My Mother's Curse" with Seth Rogen.
Streisand recently gave two concerts in June 2013 and starred in "My Mother's Curse" with Seth Rogen. Photo: Michael Kovac, WireImage Image 47 of 111 | Anna Nicole Smith Houston's own Anna Nicole Smith made her Playboy debut in the March 1992 issue.
Houston's own Anna Nicole Smith made her Playboy debut in the March 1992 issue. Photo: ., Playboy Image 48 of 111 | Anna Nicole Smith Following her much publicized marriage to oil tycoon Howard Marshall, Smith went on to do a reality show on the E! Network. She later died in 2007 due to a drug overdose.
Following her much publicized marriage to oil tycoon Howard Marshall, Smith went on to do a reality show on the E! Network. She later died in 2007 due to a drug overdose. Photo: Tim Aylen, AP Image 49 of 111 | Tara Reid Tara Reid was featured on the January/February 2010 cover of Playboy Tara Reid was featured on the January/February 2010 cover of Playboy Image 50 of 111 | Tara Reid Following 2012's "American Reunion" film, Reid starred in SyFy's "Sharknado" in 2013. The film became the most watched original film encore in Syfy history.
Following 2012's "American Reunion" film, Reid starred in SyFy's "Sharknado" in 2013. The film became the most watched original film encore in Syfy history. Image 51 of 111 | La Toya Jackson Singer-songwriter La Toya Jackson starred on the March 1989 Playboy cover.
Singer-songwriter La Toya Jackson starred on the March 1989 Playboy cover. Image 52 of 111 | La Toya Jackson Following several appearances on reality television shows, including "The Apprentice", Jackson will have her own series on Oprah Winfrey's OWN network in 2013.
Following several appearances on reality television shows, including "The Apprentice", Jackson will have her own series on Oprah Winfrey's OWN network in 2013. Image 53 of 111 | Cindy Crawford Cindy Crawford posed nude for Playboy in 1988. She made a second return to the magazine a decade later.
Cindy Crawford posed nude for Playboy in 1988. She made a second return to the magazine a decade later. Image 54 of 111 | Cindy Crawford Crawford has left full-time modeling and is usually seen on TV, promoting her line of furniture from the "Cindy Crawford Home Collection".
Crawford has left full-time modeling and is usually seen on TV, promoting her line of furniture from the "Cindy Crawford Home Collection". Photo: Evan Agostini, Associated Press Image 55 of 111 | Joan Collins Dynasty star Joan Collins made her debut in Playboy in December 1983 at the age of 50.
Dynasty star Joan Collins made her debut in Playboy in December 1983 at the age of 50. Image 56 of 111 | Joan Collins Following Dynasty, Collins has cultivated a successful book career and still makes appearances on American and British television shows.
Following Dynasty, Collins has cultivated a successful book career and still makes appearances on American and British television shows. Image 57 of 111 | Mariel Hemingway Mariel Hemingway, probably best known for her role in Woody Allen's "Manhattan", appeared in Playboy in the April 1982 issue. Mariel Hemingway, probably best known for her role in Woody Allen's "Manhattan", appeared in Playboy in the April 1982 issue. Image 58 of 111 | Mariel Hemingway Hemingway continues to make television appearances and worked on a documentary film that made its debut at the 2013 Sundance Film Festival
Hemingway continues to make television appearances and worked on a documentary film that made its debut at the 2013 Sundance Film Festival Photo: Getty Images Image 59 of 111 | Farrah Fawcett Farrah Fawcett appeared in Playboy several times, beginning in 1978. She appeared semi-nude in the 1995 issue.
Farrah Fawcett appeared in Playboy several times, beginning in 1978. She appeared semi-nude in the 1995 issue. Photo: Getty Images Image 60 of 111 | Farrah Fawcett Fawcett did several moves and TV shows before she was diagnosed with cancer in 2006. She died in 2009.
Fawcett did several moves and TV shows before she was diagnosed with cancer in 2006. She died in 2009. Photo: CHRIS O'MEARA, Associated Press Image 61 of 111 | Marge Simpson Fictional cartoon character Marge Simpson made a tongue-in-cheek appearance in the November 2009 issue, becoming the first cartoon character to appear on the cover of the magazine.
Fictional cartoon character Marge Simpson made a tongue-in-cheek appearance in the November 2009 issue, becoming the first cartoon character to appear on the cover of the magazine. Image 62 of 111 | Marge Simpson Marge hasn't aged a day since her 1989 debut. She and the rest of the family are on their 25th season.
Marge hasn't aged a day since her 1989 debut. She and the rest of the family are on their 25th season. Photo: AP Image 63 of 111 | Steve Martin Steve Martin and his hairy chest were front and center of Playboy's January 1980 cover.
Steve Martin and his hairy chest were front and center of Playboy's January 1980 cover. Image 64 of 111 | Steve Martin In addition to this acting career, Martin is also a musician. He began touring with the Steep Canyon Rangers and Edie Brickell in May 2013
In addition to this acting career, Martin is also a musician. He began touring with the Steep Canyon Rangers and Edie Brickell in May 2013 Photo: Raphael Kluzniok, The Chronicle Image 65 of 111 | Jerry Seinfeld Comedian Jerry Seinfeld shared some space on October's 1993 Playboy cover.
Comedian Jerry Seinfeld shared some space on October's 1993 Playboy cover. Image 66 of 111 | Jerry Seinfeld Seinfeld was recently nominated for a Primetime Emmy for his work on the Internet talk show "Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee".
Seinfeld was recently nominated for a Primetime Emmy for his work on the Internet talk show "Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee". Photo: Larry Busacca, (Credit Too Long, See Caption) Image 67 of 111 | Madonna Madonna graced the cover of Playboy in September 1985. She caused quite a stir earlier that year for nude photos she had taken in 1978. Madonna graced the cover of Playboy in September 1985. She caused quite a stir earlier that year for nude photos she had taken in 1978. Image 68 of 111 | Madonna In 2012, Madonna performed in the Super Bowl XLVI halftime show, drawing record viewership numbers. She has continued supporting her various charities centered around third-world countries.
In 2012, Madonna performed in the Super Bowl XLVI halftime show, drawing record viewership numbers. She has continued supporting her various charities centered around third-world countries. Image 69 of 111 | Jenny McCarthy Jenny McCarthy made her Playboy debut in 1993 and has continued to appear on a number of covers over the years, including this 2005 issue.
Jenny McCarthy made her Playboy debut in 1993 and has continued to appear on a number of covers over the years, including this 2005 issue. Image 70 of 111 | Jenny McCarthy In July 2013, McCarthy announced she was going to be the new co-host for ABC's "The View", replacing Elisabeth Hasselbeck.
In July 2013, McCarthy announced she was going to be the new co-host for ABC's "The View", replacing Elisabeth Hasselbeck. Image 71 of 111 | Jessica Alba In 2006, a promotional image of Jessica Alba's movie "Into the Blue" was used as Playboy's cover. Alba was not thrilled and filed suit. It was later dropped when Hugh Hefner apologized and donated to charities of Alba's choosing.
less In 2006, a promotional image of Jessica Alba's movie "Into the Blue" was used as Playboy's cover. Alba was not thrilled and filed suit. It was later dropped when Hugh Hefner apologized and donated to ... more Image 72 of 111 | Jessica Alba Alba is set to star in the sequel to 2010's "Machete" and 2005's "Sin City".
Alba is set to star in the sequel to 2010's "Machete" and 2005's "Sin City". Photo: AP Image 73 of 111 Continue clicking to see the celebrities who support the "Free The Nipple" cause.
Continue clicking to see the celebrities who support the "Free The Nipple" cause.

(Photo by ... more Photo: Getty Images Image 111 of 111 Remember when Playboy said they wouldn't feature nudes? Yeah, they've changed their minds. 1 / 111 Back to Gallery On Monday morning, Playboy magazine released a photo of their March/April 2017 cover, which features a topless Elizabeth Elam above the "Naked is normal" headline, despite announcing a year ago that the publication pledged to ban nudity.
ONE YEAR AGO: Under new format, Playboy will stop spreading the nudes
On the cover, the magazine also teases to the content inside saying, "Free the Nipple by Scarlett Byrne. Finding Love While Saving the World. Van Jones, American Hero. 20Q: Adam Scott. Run the Jewels Fight the Power. The Interview: Scarlett Johansson. Cannabis: A User's Guide."
Cooper Hefner, 25, the son of Playboy founder Hugh Hefner, took over as chief creative officer at Playboy last October and he, too, released a statement about the decision to go back to featuring nude photographs.
Amazon announced on Thursday that it has ordered 13 episodes of the Hugh Hefner docuseries American Playboy. The series is scheduled for a 2017 release and it will combine footage from Hef's personal archive along with reenactments and interviews. The founding of Playboy magazine will be the focus of the series along with how Hefner has transformed American culture. Hefner is largely involved in the project and said, "It has been a long road in finding the right partners to tell the full story of Playboy." He also said that he hopes his story "will inspire others to pursue their dreams."
Media: WochIt Media "I'll be the first to admit that the way in which the magazine portrayed nudity was dated, but removing it entirely was a mistake. Nudity was never the problem because nudity isn't a problem. Today we're taking our identity back and reclaiming who we are," Hefner said on Twitter .
Last year, the 25-year-old creative officer originally disagreed with the choice to purge nudes from the publication. "I didn't agree with the decision because I felt as though millennials and Gen-Y didn't view nudity as the issue," Hefner said in a video interview . "The issue was the way in which nudity and the girls were portrayed."
Along with nudes, this spring issue of Playboy will bring back former franchises, including "The Playboy Philosophy" and "Party Jokes," and the phrase "Entertainment for Men" has been banished from the cover.
The issue is available for download at Playboy.com and hits newsstands nationwide February 28.
